issues: Line numbers referenced (line 31, line 94, line 96) are specific to older Flutter templates and may not match current Flutter 3.38.x counter app template
The lesson mentions 'about 110 lines of code' in main.dart but current flutter create generates a more concise template with Material 3 defaults
The 'blue app bar' description is outdated - Flutter 3.16+ uses Material 3 by default with ColorScheme.fromSeed, resulting in different default colors (often purple/indigo based)
Hot Restart shortcut listed as 'Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + F5' - the standard is just the circular arrow button or 'flutter clean && flutter run'; keyboard shortcuts vary by IDE configuration
Widget test example uses 'MyApp()' without 'const' keyword which would trigger linter warning in modern Flutter
recommendations: Remove or generalize specific line number references since they change between Flutter versions
Update the app bar color description to mention Material 3 theming (purple/deep purple with ColorScheme.fromSeed)
Add 'const' to widget instantiations in test examples: 'await tester.pumpWidget(const MyApp())'
Reference the actual VS Code debug controls (Start Debugging, Restart, Stop) rather than specific keyboard shortcuts

suggestedNewContent.title: Common First-Run Problems
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Cover: Device not detected (run flutter devices), first Android build takes 5-10 minutes for Gradle downloads, iOS requires Xcode setup, Chrome requires no extra setup - emphasize Chrome for beginners

suggestedNewContent.title: Flutter Project Structure - The House Blueprint
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Compare lib/ to the living space you design, android/ios/web folders to different construction methods for different land types, pubspec.yaml to the materials list, and main.dart to the front door

suggestedNewContent.title: Understanding the Terminal Output
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Briefly explain: Resolving dependencies, Running Gradle task, Compiling Dart, what 'Syncing files to device' means, and why first run is slow but subsequent runs are fast

suggestedNewContent.title: If Something Goes Wrong
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Basic troubleshooting: Run flutter doctor, try flutter clean then flutter run, restart VS Code, check device connection. Emphasize that errors are normal and not to panic

summary: The lesson provides a solid introduction to running a first Flutter app but contains several outdated references to Flutter's pre-Material 3 era. Line number references are fragile and will break with Flutter updates. The widget testing section is premature for Module 0 and should be removed. The lesson would benefit from a WARNING section on common issues and better troubleshooting guidance. Overall structure is good but needs freshness updates for Flutter 3.38.x and Material 3 defaults.
